file_content.text: Shame the Esh-kha can't fight for us. Still, you made the right call.
You made the right call. When we're ready, the Esh-kha will serve us well.
The Esh-kha's prison break is over. Here's their key.
Incredible. We must report this at once.
Commander Calum. The situation's under control.
Thank you for the update, Colonel. I will call off the bombardment.
First Ellis Ruger, then the rioting aliens, now the Esh-kha.
First you free the Dread Masters, now you halt the Esh-kha's escape.
First you storm the Esh-kha's vault, then you actually stop their escape.
Such feats require more than strength and skill with a lightsaber. The Emperor is most impressed, my lord.
The Emperor and I understand each other.
He told you that, did he?
I see.
The dark side alone cannot accomplish such feats. The Emperor recognizes your power, my lord.
Intelligence has many operatives embedded on Belsavis. You outperformed them all. The Emperor is most appreciative.
Few mercenaries would accept such contracts, much less complete them. The Emperor thanks you.
Our mission on Belsavis succeeds because of your talents. You have earned the Emperor's gratitude.
Thank you, Commander.
I don't dispense empty accolades.
Who pays me? You? The Emperor?
Of course. Anything for a loyal servant.
I'd rather have his money.
Of course. I will arrange a transfer through the usual channels.
Excuse me, Commander. There's still the matter of the surviving Esh-kha. Thousands remain caged on Belsavis.
Anything else?
There's still the surviving Esh-kha to deal with. Thousands remain caged here.
Your recommendation, Colonel?
The key's ours. Why not keep the Esh-kha riled up? Then some day, we unleash them on our enemies.
I appreciate their potential, but your inability to control them makes your opinion worthless.
You, on the other hand, have triumphed over these aliens. Are they too dangerous to control? Or does their brutal efficiency outweigh the risks?
Shy away from the Esh-kha, and you turn your back on the perfect weapon.
Use them as weapons.
Very well. Deliver the key to me, Colonel. In time, we may unleash these creatures on the Republic.
Free those monsters and you'll unleash a terror on the galaxy--something you'll never control.
The Esh-kha are too dangerous.
Colonel, deliver the key to me for incineration. Then catalog the remaining Esh-kha vaults. Containment is our top priority.
As you wish, Commander.
As for you, the Emperor still requires your services. The Dread Masters must be freed.
The Republic has moved the Sith Lords. They're in Belsavis's deepest depths--with the prison's most twisted monstrosities.
Our operations groups pursued, then fell silent. Seek them out, contact me and together we will coordinate the Dread Masters' escape.
Thank you again for your services. The Emperor will watch your progress closely.
Excuse me. Colonel Grang's saying some words for the fallen.
Sergeant Herral was a good soldier. He fought like a true Imperial, and he died a hero.
Give the kid a medal. Tell his Senator father he died quick. Not a word about Belsavis or these creatures.
Yes, sir. We have company.
Pardon the mess, my lord. Lost most of my unit to a bunch of crazed aliens. You're looking at all that's left of Operations Group Three.
Hello, agent. Afraid I can't offer hospitality since those crazed aliens attacked. You're looking at all that's left of Operations Group Three.
This is an Imperial operation, merc. But, as you can see, I have some vacancies to fill. Interested in hunting some rampaging aliens?
I won't kill a single alien unless credits are on the table.
Depends on the pay.
At least you're honest. Assist, and I'll pad your account.
Not really. Should I be?
Maybe credits will buy your interest in the Empire's cause.
Excuse the mess. Lost most of my unit to an army of crazed aliens. We're all that's left of Operations Group Three.
Commander Calum sent me. Concerning the Dread Masters.
I'm here on official business.
The Dread Masters aren't here. But if we don't exterminate these aliens soon, we'll never free them.
Your men have failed you, Colonel. My lightsaber will serve you better.
Perhaps I can help.
I appreciate the offer, my lord. Blasters didn't work against those aliens, but maybe your lightsaber will.
Belsavis devours the frail, Colonel. You should've brought stronger men.
Your unit must have been weak.
My men weren't the problem. It's those aliens... I've never seen anything like them.
Belsavis is harsh. But victory demands sacrifice.
Chin up, Colonel.
We're on the same page. We can't afford a loss here--freakish aliens or not.
I can fill the boots of twenty men, but I'll cost you just as much.
You Imps need to hire help?
I'm willing to pay. Anything to get back at those aliens.
You're being vague, Colonel. What species are we talking about?
What kind of aliens?
No idea. Looks like we stumbled on some uncharted freaks.
Soldiers die. Deal with it.
It's not their death that gets me. It's those things that tore 'em apart.
We were deployed to free prisoners--old friends of the Empire incarcerated by the Republic.
My team broke open vaults. Then we unleashed these vicious aliens--Esh-kha, they're called. I hear you've met them before.
I met the Esh-kha in battle. I was the only survivor.
Correct.
I've toasted my share of Esh-kha during my stay on Belsavis.
Oh, we've met.
There was a disagreement. The Esh-kha lost.
We exchanged a few words.
Some Esh-kha got in my way. They're dead now.
Met 'em and blasted 'em.
I suspected as much.
That's classified.
I've heard the rumors anyway. About you saving the Dread Masters.
At any rate, we're still recovering intel on the brutes. Take their prison records for instance.
So you freed the Esh-kha?
I apologize, my lord. I've since dedicated myself to ending their rampage.
My unit acted of their own accord, but I don't want to malign the dead.
I reported the incident to Commander Calum immediately. We also collected prison records describing the aliens.
Found files calling the Esh-kha an ancient conqueror species, imprisoned thousands of years. Still working out the details.
Our mission was to clear the path for the Dread Masters' rescue. That meant springing prisoners to keep the Republic busy.
My team broke vaults open. We unleashed something awful. Vicious aliens, armed and out for blood. There's no record of their existence.
Turn these creatures against the Republic, and our problems are solved.
Such aliens could be useful.
We tried herding them, but they're too smart. Broke loose and went berserk. That's when we discovered their prison records.
Tell me you set up a perimeter and contained the outbreak.
I trust you followed protocol.
Of course. But the aliens broke through. That's when we started digging through the prison's records.
New species fetch high prices. I can't wait.
Sounds like worthy prey.
Collecting trophies won't be easy. Not if the prison records are any indication.
I just broke up an entire wing of rioting aliens. I can handle a few more.
Aliens don't scare me.
These brutes are off the charts, not your typical back world freaks. Luckily we discovered their prison records.
I'm not afraid of aliens.
That may be, but these brutes are smart and armed. And prison records aren't exactly encouraging.
You should've checked those vaults before opening them.
Bad move, Colonel.
The Republic didn't have any records. It wasn't until after they were out that we discovered old prison data.
Found references to "Esh-kha," an ancient conqueror species locked up for thousands of years. Details are still unclear.
This alien scum's out of the military's league, my lord. I'd be grateful if you could wipe them out.
Containing these freaks will take an expert, both in combat and black ops. You up for the mission?
Hear that, hunter? Thousands of years. How'd you like first shot at a freshly thawed species?
We're dealing with some mean scum. And if we don't wipe them out fast, we may never rescue the Dread Masters.
These aliens are vile bullies. If we don't exterminate them soon, they could wipe out our entire operation on Belsavis.
Years of imprisonment have made them hungry. I'll break their resolve.
Leave the Esh-kha to me.
The Esh-kha never should have strayed from their cells. Now they'll taste my power.
Very well. I'll handle them.
Thank you, my lord. Those brutes don't know what they're in for.
I'll make sure the Esh-kha are forgotten for another thousand years.
Consider it done.
Good. It's time those brutes see some Imperial justice.
I expect payment for each fallen Esh-kha. And I'm keeping count.
I'll help, but I have demands.
Fulfill the contract and we'll take care of everything.
I might help. Perhaps.
That's good enough for me.
What bounty am I looking at?
Most of my unit's dead. You can have their fee, plus more if you're thorough.
You'll find the Esh-kha in their prison vault. Search the place. We can't risk missing any.
You can do it. [Refuse quest]
The Esh-kha are everywhere. Soon there'll be no escaping them.
I'm conducting official Imperial business. Move along.
Make the Esh-kha pay.
Could be fun.
